IMPORTANT: If you do not see the new version on the App Store, please go to the Updates tab, then refresh the list manually by scrolling down a few times.
Steam should auto-update Hades' Star to the latest version soon. If you keep getting this message, please check the game's update settings and re-launch Steam.

You have been disconnected from the server due to inactivity.
The server will be shutting down in a few minutes for maintenance.
We regularly do server maintenance to improve the game.\n\nMore Information
Are you sure you want to destroy this ship forever? This will increase your fleet capacity.
Are you sure you want to quit the game?
This action is not available at this phase of the tutorial
Select a view in this star system to share with your Corporation
We apologize for the recent server outage. We have added {0} Crystals to your account as compensation. Thank you for your patience!\n\n- Hades' Star team
You must expand further into your star system before you can build this station
Insufficient Storage. Upgrade your planets to increase storage.
Server busy. Please try again in a few moments.

You cannot build any more of this Station type

You need to wait for the module to cool down before you can use it again
This module is passive and cannot be activated
You must wait until construction of the Hub is complete
Both Hubs must be inactive for a new link to be established
You must construct at least two Hubs before you can link them
Cannot drop artifacts on other player's outposts
You cannot change a ship's modules away from your home star
Only the planet's owner can use this shipment
This outpost cannot hold any more shipments
You cannot move directly to a star
Cannot move while under the influence of BOND
This sector cannot support more asteroid fields
Cannot use this module. The owner ship is not carrying any cargo.
The target ship does not have capacity to receive any cargo
Cannot use Entrust while cargo is loading
Cannot use Genesis on the Star sector
Cannot use this module on a White Star Jump Gate sector
Cannot use this module on this star type
You can only use this module on public Red Star level {0} and higher
This module cannot be activated unless there are enemy ships in the sector
This module cannot be activated unless there are enemy ships in range
Cannot activate, no valid teleport target found
Cannot activate Shield while Vengeance is active
This module requires more Hydrogen collected on your Miner ship before it can be activated.
This star system is private and cannot be visited at the moment
Only Officers can give orders to the Corporation Flagship.
The Flagship is currently in another Star.
The Flagship is already in this Star.
The Flagship is currently on cooldown.
Shipyards allow you to create new ships.
Your Empire has discovered a new Star System
Your Empire grows by colonizing more planets.\n\nPlanets provide income via shipments, and allow you to build space stations.
Transport ships are vital to growing your economy. It's a good idea to keep at least one transport ship around each planet you have colonized.
Miner ships are vital for building infrastructure around your planets.
Trading Stations provide you with additional shipments that can be delivered to your planets for profit.
Upgrading your planets improves shipment quality and increases the maximum amount of resources you can store
Use your Transport ships to deliver shipments between the planet and its moons.\n\nDelivering shipments helps you earn resources and experience.

Expanding to new planets is vital for growing your Empire.\n\nBefore you can colonize a planet, you have to move at least one of your ships to the surface. The more planets you have colonized, the more expensive colonizing the next one becomes.
Colonized planets can also be used to repair your ships. Colonize the planet near your damaged Battleship to start the process.
• Click on a Shipment to load it
• Use the MOVE button or Right-click on the glowing shipment destination
• Click DEPART or Right-click on the destination
• Use the Move command or drag your ship to the planet to pick up more shipments
• Click the MOVE button or Right-click on the planet to pick up more shipments
• Use the Move command or drag your ship to the moon to pick up more shipments
• Click the MOVE button or Right-click on the moon to pick up more shipments
• Use the Move command or drag your ship to the new planet
• Click the MOVE button or Right-click on the new planet
Asteroid fields contain valuable Hydrogen. You should always ensure your Empire has at least a few Miner ships that are busy mining around the clock.
Miner ships collect Hydrogen from asteroid fields. They will keep collecting from the same asteroid field until it is depleted.
Transport ships are vital to growing your economy. It's a good idea to keep at least one transport ship around each planet you have colonized.
The Short Range Scanner station allows you to explore nearby sectors, allowing you to see and travel deeper in this star system.
Construct a Short Range Scanner and use it to find and colonize a third planet.
Mysterious Cerberus ships appear throughout the Hades Galaxy. Fight back against them using Battleships.
Battleships are crucial for maintaining the security of your other ships, and pushing back against Cerberus forces.
• Use the Move command or drag your Battleship near the Cerberus Sentinel
• Click the MOVE button or Right-click to move your Battleship near the Cerberus Sentinel
The Red Star Scanner allows you to find and travel to new stars
JUMP YOUR TRANSPORT SHIP TO THE RED STAR
You can move ships between star systems by using Jumpgates.
Use your Red Star Scanner to discover a new star system.
• Select the Move command or drag your ship to the Red Star Scanner
• Click the MOVE button or Right-click to move your ship to the Red Star Scanner
BRING BACK AN ARTIFACT FROM THE RED STAR
Planets near Red Stars are rich in Artifacts. Bring back an Artifact so you can start researching it.
• Move your ship back to the Jump Gate
• Move your Transport ship to the planet
• Click on the Artifact to start loading it
A research station allows you to study Artifacts. Construct one in your star system now.
• Move your Transport ship to the Research Station
Once a ship has departed, you cannot change its course and must wait until it reaches its destination.
Red Stars will go supernova shortly after being discovered. Make sure your ships have returned to the Jump Gate before the timer runs out.
Your Miner ship will keep mining until all asteroid fields on its hex sector are depleted, or until your Hydrogen capacity is full.
Once construction completes, the Short Range scanner will allow you to start exploring new sectors in this star system.
Once the Red Star Scanner detects a new star, it will act as a Stargate, allowing docked ships to jump to the new system.
Combat ships have an attack range you can see by selecting them. They will automatically attack enemy ships that enter that range.
Moving a ship costs Hydrogen. Keep an eye on your total Hydrogen supply, and ensure you constantly have Miners collecting new Hydrogen from Asteroid fields.
You can keep delivering shipments to earn income while your Battleship is travelling.
Any damaged ship will slowly repair when docked on a colonized planet, moon or station.
Planets in Red Stars have Artifacts that can be researched. Unlike regular shipments, Artifacts take time to load onto your Transport ships.
The Research station can store, research or salvage any Artifacts you retrieve.

Hades' Star can send notifications to your device for important events, such as when your Miner ship needs new orders.\n\nIf you choose not to allow such notifications, you can enable them later in your device's settings.
The shipyard allows you to create additional ships. It can be upgraded to increase your total fleet capacity.
Upgrade your shipyard to level {0}, to allow you to build more ships.
The Objectives window provides additional goals and guidance for your journey in the Hades Galaxy.
Ships can be upgraded by installing modules. Modules can be either activated or passive, and provide unique advantages to each ship.
Allows construction of ships. Upgrade to increase your Empire's total fleet capacity.

The Red Star Scanner can detect nearby stars that are going Supernova. Those stars usually have old planets with valuable artifacts, but are also guarded by Cerberus forces.\n\nOther players can use their Red Star Scanners to gain access to the same stars.
Creates and accepts shipments to and from your planets. Must be placed in an empty sector.
Allows establishing diplomatic relations with other players. Players in diplomatic relations can send ships to each other's system.
The Diplomacy Station can create a two way jump gate with another player's home system. Once linked, both players can send ships to the other side.
Two hubs that can connect to create a temporary Warp Lane in your system. An active Warp Lane allows ships to travel instantly and without consuming Hydrogen.
This Warp Lane Hub can be connected to another Hub for one day, for a fixed Hydrogen cost. Once connected, ships can travel between the two end points instantly and without consuming Hydrogen.
Scattered throughout the Hades Galaxy, these mysterious structures allow ships to jump between star systems.
Analyzes Artifacts found in Red Stars.
The Research Station can store and research Artifacts. Send your Transport ship here to automatically deposit new artifacts.
Can reveal hidden sectors adjacent to the sector it is placed on.
This scanner allows you to reveal adjacent sectors in your star system.
Upgrading the Red Star Scanner will allow it to find higher level Red Stars which contain better Artifacts, but are also guarded by stronger Cerberus forces.
Upgrading the Shipyard allows you to operate a larger number of ships.
Upgrading the Research Station allows you to research higher order Artifacts
Allows you to locate and send ships to White Stars. You must be part of a Corporation to access White Stars.
Allows speeding up time over an entire Yellow Star System.
An advanced station that draws power from a Yellow Star to manipulate time. Use it to speed up the passage of time in your Yellow Star. Upgrade to increase the speed up factor.

The scanner will send a single Battleship to a detected Blue Star. Blue Stars constantly collapse from the outside towards the star, have a very short lifetime, and offer no security: all participating player's Battleships will fire on each other, as well as the Cerberus forces in the system. The player with the last Battleship alive wins the mission.
This non-functional portal seems to lead to distant stars. Construct a Blue Star scanner on it to allow Battleships to pass through.
This station must be placed on an Anomaly
Start building a Blue Star scanner on the Anomaly?
Allows some shipments to be delivered automatically, using Fragments retrieved in Blue Stars.

Enables automatic shipment delivery on a per-sector basis, for a limited amount of time.

The sectors that the Relay is controlling will have Credits Shipments delivered automatically over time, regardless of the Shipment's destination. Upgrade the Relay to increase the amount of shipments and controlled sectors.

The Relay requires Star Fragments to operate. They can be earned by participating in Blue Star missions.
Picks up and delivers shipments between planets and Trade Stations
Transport ships are crucial for trade. Use them to deliver shipments between planets and moons, and to transfer Artifacts from Red Stars.
A slow and weak ship that can collect Hydrogen from asteroid fields
Miner ships can collect Hydrogen from asteroid fields
A combat ship that can be equipped with additional weapon modules

Sentinels have weak hulls but are equipped with a very powerful Battery. They pose little threat individually, but are deadly in large numbers or when covered behind stronger Cerberus ships.\n\nSentinels will always stay within their assigned sector.
A massive Cerberus ship that requires a lot of firepower and coordination to bring down.\n\nThis ship will always stay within its assigned sector.
A strong ship that Cerberus often use to provide cover for Sentinels.\n\nGuardians always stay within their assigned sector.

A fast and powerful Cerberus ship that can simultaneously fire against 4 enemy ships.\n\nThe Interceptor will become Activated when an enemy ship enters its assigned sector or comes close enough to fire on it. Once Activated, it will hunt down enemy ships across all sectors, making it very dangerous against non-combat ships.

These mysterious Cerberus ships are known to jump in Red Stars and destroy entire planets with their powerful beams. When the Destroyer is defeated or a planet destroyed, Area damage will be applied to all nearby player ships.
The Phoenix protects nearby Cerberus ships with its area shield. Once destroyed, it will spawn a small number of Sentinels.\n\nThis ship will always stay within its assigned sector.
An automated, fast but weak combat ship. The drone travels to its fixed destination and stays there until destroyed or its activation timer runs out.
An automated, fast drone that will automatically deliver shipments when possible. The drone can only cross sectors if they are connected with an active Warp Lane.
An automated mining ship that targets a single asteroid. Once mining is complete, the drone will deliver the Hydrogen to the closest planet and self-destruct.

A strong ship that regularly fires one rocket towards each participating player that has ships in the bomber's sector or any adjacent sectors. \n\nThis ship will always stay within its assigned sector, but the Rockets can be fired on approaching ships in adjacent sectors.
This ship always follows a circular path within its sector. It is equipped with a powerful long range weapon that regularly launches fast Dart missiles against all enemy ships in range.

A group of fast ships that jump in unpredictably and move collectively to the nearest target, anywhere in the star system.\n\nGhost ships are immune to all modules that don't do damage, and do not count as ships for certain modules like Barrage and Salvage.
This ship belongs to a Corporation and can be controlled by its Officers.\n\nA Flagship can optionally assist its owner Corporation with one ongoing White Star mission.

A massive, strong ship, equipped with a powerful Barrage that does significantly more damage when there are more player ships in its sector. When it runs out of hitpoints, it will split into two smaller, weaker Hydras. The smaller versions will themselves turn into two tiny Hydras when destroyed.
A weaker version of the Cerberus Hydra. Will split into two smaller Hydras when destroyed.
The weakest version of the Cerberus Hydra. Will disappear when destroyed.
This mysterious gate is used by Cerberus Ghost ships to jump to new star systems. The gate cannot be targeted or used as a move target.
While active, increases payout on shipment delivery.
Increases the total storage of the Transport ship, allowing more Shipments or Artifacts to be carried at once.
Provides a temporary boost to Hydrogen collection speed.

Disables all ships, rockets and Cerberus Stations within the affected area for a short period of time, including the ship that triggered the EMP. Disabled ships do not move or fire, but can still activate Modules.

Automatically picks up shipments from intermediate waypoints, if those shipments' destination matches any of the ship's subsequent waypoints. Automatically picked up shipments add a bonus to their reward.\n\nAfter this module is unlocked, selecting any object that holds shipments will reveal numeric indicators showing where the shipments are headed.
Absorbs incoming damage until it is depleted or the activation timer runs out.
Absorbs incoming damage until it is depleted or the activation timer runs out. Owner ship travels faster while the shield is active.
Repairs a constant amount of hitpoints per second, shared among all damaged non-enemy ships within range.
After the Activation Delay, the ship teleports to the designated target, which must be within teleportation radius. Cannot teleport inside Barrier areas created by enemy ships.
Speeds up time in a radius around the ship. Affects travel times, combat and artifact pickup speed.\n\nAn object in range of multiple Time Warps is only affected by the highest level one.
Does damage to a single target at a time.
A powerful weapon that does increasingly higher damage the longer it stays focused on a single target.
A weak weapon that does damage to a single target at a time.
Increases the maximum amount of Hydrogen that a Miner ship can carry.
Adds a small amount of time to a Red Star's life when activated near the star.
Activating ship evades enemy ship fire completely. It will not fire on enemies, or be fired on, for the duration of the effect.
Simultaneously mines Hydrogen from all asteroid fields in the same sector, at reduced speed.
Increases Damage Per Second for the owner ship when other allied players have ships present in the same sector. The increase is proportional to the number of allied players with ships in the sector.
Increases mining speed for the activating ship, if other players are also mining in the same sector. The increase is proportional to the number of other players mining in the sector.
Reduces direct weapon damage received. All Cerberus ships in the sector move toward the owner. Enemy ships and bases prefer firing on the owner over all other potential targets.
Instantly restores a percentage of hull strength each time any ship (other than Cerberus Ghost) is destroyed in the same sector.
Prevents a single enemy ship from firing for a small period of time.

Launches a drone that will automatically pick up and deliver shipments when possible. The drone can only cross sectors if they are connected with an active Warp Lane.\n\nThe drone loads shipments to a single destination at a time. When it drops off more than one shipment, the entire delivery will yield a credit reward bonus proportional to the number of additional shipments delivered.

Does massive area damage to all enemy ships in range. Initiator ship instantly jumps to a random asteroid in the star system. If there are no asteroids left, DESTINY cannot be activated.

After the jump, the ship stays disabled for a short period of time.

Can only be activated if there are enemy ships in the sector.

The owner ship initiates teleportation to the closest ally ship engaged in combat, anywhere in the current star system. After the activation delay period, and if the targeted ally is still alive, the owner ship will jump to the object closest to the ally ship. After the jump, both the owner ship and the ally ship are disabled for a small period of time.

Creates a movement link with the targeted enemy ship. While the link is active, the enemy ship is unable to move independently. Any movement from the owner ship will be reflected on the enemy ship, so that the distance between the two ships always remains the same.

The owner ship will not be affected by a Barrier field activated by the enemy ship.

The enemy ship can break free from the link earlier by using Bond on the original ship, or a module that causes teleportation.

Does not work on public Red Star level 7 or lower. A ship that has a Cerberus under BOND influence cannot teleport in a public Red Star.

Does not work against Cerberus Storm.

Starts activating automatically when the owner ship drops below the Hull Strength Threshold. Once the Activation Delay passes, and if the owner ship is still not destroyed, a massive explosion will apply Area damage to all enemy ships in range.
A shield that is always active and can regenerate over time.\n\nThe shield only starts regenerating after it has stopped receiving damage for an amount of time equal to the Regeneration Delay.
Applies a percentage of the damage taken by this shield back to the attacker.
Absorbs hull damage taken by any allied ship in the effect area, including Transports and Miners.
Absorbs hull damage taken by any Cerberus ship in the effect area
Protects the owner ship and all friendly ships within range against Area damage only. Direct weapon damage is not absorbed by this shield and is applied directly to the hull of the ship.
Creates a force field around the ship. Enemy ships and rockets cannot move while inside the force field. Enemy ships cannot use any object inside the effect area as a target for the Teleport module.
Provides the owner a quick boost that helps it travel faster along its current route.
A battery that does additional damage to its single target when there are more enemy ships in the sector.\n\nCerberus Ghosts do not count as enemies for additional damage.
Instantly uploads a percentage of collected Hydrogen to your Empire's reserves, without needing to return to a planet.

Counts shipments delivered during the activation period. After a minimum threshold is met, every new Credits shipment delivered by the owner ship while the module is still active will yield a bonus reward.
Instantly loads the lowest value shipments from any target outpost in the star system. Does not work with Artifacts or Relics.

When the owner ship is about to be destroyed during combat or a Supernova, it jumps back to its home system instead. Any cargo on the ship will be lost.\n\nBattleships that get destroyed in a Red Star with Sanctuary equipped will not be able to return to the same star.
\n\nInstalling this module will increase the owner ship's hydrogen move cost by {0}%.
Instantly collects Hydrogen from all asteroid fields in the current sector (limited by the Max Amount and the Miner ship's total capacity).
Allows the Transport ship to teleport to any Trade Station in the current star system.

A fast but weak Rocket that can be launched towards a single fixed target. The Rocket explodes and does Area damage to all enemy ships when it reaches its destination.\n\nEnemy ships can fire on the Rocket using normal targeting rules. No damage is applied if the rocket is destroyed before it reaches its destination.

A very fast Rocket that does Area damage to all enemy ships when it reaches its final destination. The owner can optionally set a second waypoint after the launch.

Enemy ships can fire on the Rocket using normal targeting rules. No damage is applied if the rocket is destroyed before it reaches its destination.

Does not work on sectors with Jump Gates on White Stars.
A Rocket that disables all nearby ships on impact.

A strong, slow Rocket that can be launched within a limited range and does massive Area damage to all enemy ships when it reaches its destination.\n\nEnemy ships can fire on the Rocket using normal targeting rules. The Rocket still delivers a small amount of Area damage on a smaller radius to enemy ships if neutralized before reaching its destination.
Instantly increases the amount of Hydrogen stored on all asteroids in the sector. Cannot be used on the same sector more frequently than once per day.

Increases the speed of the owner Transport ship when it carries any shipments destined to the ship's next waypoint. The speed increase is proportional to the number of shipments destined to the next waypoint.
Instantly creates new asteroid fields on the Miner's current sector.\n\nDoes not work on sectors with Jump Gates on White Stars.
Allows the owner transport ship to instantly teleport its cargo to another transport ship in range. Works with Shipments and fully loaded Artifacts and Relics.

When active, the Transport ship will deliver all of its shipments upon arriving on a Trade Station, regardless of the shipments' actual destination. Shipments not originally destined to the Trade Station will yield a reduced payoff.

Launches a single combat drone towards a destination anywhere in the Star System. The drone will automatically travel to the destination and stay there until destroyed or its activation timer runs out.\n\nDoes not work on sectors with Jump Gates on White Stars.

Launches an independent ship towards the target asteroid, which must be within range of miner ship. The drone will keep mining from the asteroid until it is depleted or its capacity fills up. After the mining is done, the drone will deposit the Hydrogen to the closest planet and self destruct.
Launches one Bomber Rocket towards each enemy player that has ships in the Bomber's sector or any adjacent sectors. Each Rocket travels towards the enemy player's closest ship.

A strong Rocket that causes area damage to all player ships when it reaches its destination. The Rocket still delivers a smaller amount of Area damage on a smaller radius if neutralized before reaching its destination.

Launches a DART missile against the targeted enemy ship at regular intervals.

The missile can be neutralized by any enemy ship using normal targeting rules.

When the missile reaches its destination it will apply direct weapon damage to the target ship only, and only if the target ship is still within the impact area.

This weapon will only fire on enemy ships. Rockets and Cerberus stations are ignored.
A missile that is launched against a single ship. Once the missile reaches its destination, it will apply damage to the target ship if that ship is within the explosion range.

The Transport ship initiates teleport to the planet with the most items (Shipments, Artifacts or Relics) in the star system. If more than one planets have the same amount of items, the farthest planet is picked.\n\nThe Teleport completes after the preparation time elapses. The preparation time is proportional to the amount of items on the target planet at the time of activation.

Allows the Miner ship to launch a powerful Rocket, anywhere in the star system.\n\nTo activate, the Miner ship must have collected at least the Required Hydrogen amount. The Hydrogen is consumed on activation.

A powerful Rocket launched by a Miner ship. The Rocket explodes and does Area damage to all enemy ships when it reaches its destination.\n\nEnemy ships can fire on the Rocket using normal targeting rules. No damage is applied if the rocket is destroyed before it reaches its destination.
Regularly fires a fast Dart missile against all enemy ships in range.
Slows down time in a large area around the ship. Overrides any effect of Time Warp within the effect area.\n\nAn object in range of multiple Suspend areas is only affected by the highest level one.

The Flagship enters a Teleport countdown, heading anywhere in the star system. After the countdown ends, the Flagship will jump to the destination and will immediately enter a second Teleport countdown, heading back to its original position.
Instantly destroys all Cerberus ships in the sector.

Leaves a stationary Bomb at the ship's current location. The bomb will start triggering once an enemy ship enters the blast range. All enemy ships within the blast range will take area damage after the trigger period is over. The bomb can be targeted by enemy ships using regular targeting rules. If neutralized before the trigger period expires, it will apply less area damage across a smaller range.

Not affected by Area damage.

Not useable in Yellow stars.

A stationary bomb that will start triggering once an enemy ship enters its blast range. All enemy ships within the blast range will take area damage after the trigger period is over. The bomb can be targeted by enemy ships using regular targeting rules. If neutralized before the trigger period expires, it will apply less area damage across a smaller range.
Spawns Cerberus ships daily. Do not attempt to approach before building a sizeable combat fleet.
Desert planets produce lower reward shipments and provide ample space for storing Hydrogen.
Fire planets produce decent reward shipments and give your Empire a small income of Credits and Hydrogen per hour.
Water planets produce decent reward shipments and give your Empire a steady income of Credits per hour.
Terran planets produce regular reward shipments and give your Empire a small income of Hydrogen per hour.
Gas planets produce regular reward shipments and give your Empire a small income of Credits per hour.
Ice planets produce high reward shipments and give your Empire a steady income of Credits and Hydrogen per hour.
This planet may hold ancient Artifacts, useful for researching new Modules.
Yellow stars contain numerous habitable planets and are great for building base infrastructure. Each Empire is assigned its own Yellow Star to establish its base of operations.
Red Stars are very unstable. They usually contain uninhabitable planets with Artifacts.
As the only source of Relics, White Stars are highly sought after by Corporations in the Hades Galaxy.
This dangerous system has a very limited lifetime and collapses from the outside toward the star.\n\nThe Star will do direct damage to any ship in its sector.

<creditColor>Credits</color> is the main currency, used to buy ships, unlock modules, build and upgrade infrastructure.
<hydrogenColor>Hydrogen</color> is used to move ships around a star system, to jump them to new star systems, and to activate certain modules.
<crystalColor>Crystals</color> can be used to buy Credits and Hydrogen, and to speed up various operations.
Storage is full. Upgrade your planets to increase storage.

Select one of these recommended players to request diplomatic relations.\n\nYou can also send a request to any other player from their profile window.

+{0} Credits from shipments delivered by diplomatic partners

Sign in to GameCenter to save progress and to access your account from another iPhone or iPad

Landscape mode support is experimental and may have issues. It is only recommended for larger devices like tablets.

The game will now exit. Please relaunch Hades' Star from Steam to start playing in your new star.
This process will erase all your Steam progress and start a new game under your current Steam account. You will lose access to this game forever.
You will not be able to transfer any resources, including resources purchased via in-app purchases, to the new game.

Only your Steam progress will be reset. If you have other platforms associated with this game, you will still be able to access it from those platforms. It is not possible to restart the game on other platforms. For more information, see the HELP & SUPPORT link in the SETTINGS window.
This is your final confirmation. If you continue, the current game will be lost.
I understand and wish to continue.
Are you sure you want to change language? The game will need to restart.
Use this page if you want to access your account from another device.\n\nWhich device are you on now?
What is the type of the new device you want to link to?

To play on multiple Android devices, make sure to sign in to your Google account in the settings window.\n\nOn the new device, sign in with the same Google account. You will be asked if you want to switch to your other account. Select OK and your progress will be synchronized.

To play on multiple iOS devices, make sure to sign in to GameCenter first.\n\nOn the new device, sign in with the same GameCenter account before launching the game. You will be asked if you want to switch to your other account. Select OK and your progress will be synchronized.
You can access your game from any PC or Mac running Steam. Just sign in with your Steam account and launch the game.
To get a link code, go to the settings window on your old device, select Link a device, then 'This is the OLD device'

XP level indicates a player's general progress in the Galaxy. Delivering shipments and upgrading planets increases the XP level.
Influence indicates a player's operational capability. Influence can be earned (or lost) by participating in Red Star missions.

Star Fragments are earned by participating in Blue Star missions. They can be used to climb the monthly Blue Star leaderboards and to receive guaranteed Crystal rewards at the end of each Blue Star season.

White Star points are earned by contributing in White Star missions. They can be used to climb the monthly White Star leaderboards and to receive guaranteed Crystal rewards at the end of each White Star season.

You can send ships through this Station to retrieve artifacts from the detected Red Star.\n\nBe careful: Any ships that do not make it back before the star goes Supernova will be lost forever.

Scanner is Cooling Down. New Scan Available In:
Anyone can join this Red Star.
Only Corporation members can join this Red Star. The scan will be posted on the Corporation chat page.
Join a Corporation to unlock private Red Stars.
This scanner allows you to find distant Red Stars. These stars have a very small lifetime, contain valuable Artifacts that you can research, and are usually guarded by Cerberus forces.
You cannot receive any more influence from this Red Star level.
You cannot receive any more influence from this Red Star level. Upgrade the Scanner to gain access to higher level Stars that can give you more Influence.
Destroy enough Cerberus ships and retrieve artifacts in this Red Star to receive {0}-{1} Influence.
Each player gets their own Artifacts in Red Stars. You cannot steal other player's Artifacts. Defeating the Cerberus forces together is the best strategy.
There is no combat between player ships in Red Stars. Your Battleships will only fire against Cerberus forces.
Upgrading your Red Star Scanner allows it to find higher level Red Stars. Higher level stars contain better Artifacts, but are also guarded by stronger Cerberus forces.
Use the Chat window to coordinate strategies with other players.
Though retrieving Artifacts is the primary goal, Red Stars are also rich in Asteroid Fields. Just make sure your Miner ships stay out of harm's way, or protect them with Battleships.
Participating in Red Star missions is a great way to gain Influence, which can help you and your Corporation climb higher on the leaderboards.
It's a good idea to move some ships to the Red Star Scanner while the search is in progress. That way you'll be ready to jump them immediately when the star is found, without losing valuable time.
Keep an eye on your empire Hydrogen levels, to make sure you have enough to jump all your ships to the Red Star and back to safety.
Position your undamaged Battleships in the front lines so they take most enemy fire and protect more vulnerable ships behind them.
Some modules work best when other players' ships are nearby.
You can only have one Artifact loading on a Transport ship at a time.
The bigger the artifact, the more resources and Blueprints it will provide when researched.
Orb Artifacts contain Blueprints for Weapon and Shield modules that you can fit on your Battleships.
Blue Crystal Artifacts contain Blueprints for modules that increase efficiency of your Transport and Miner ships.
Tetrahedron Artifacts contain Blueprints for powerful support modules that can be equipped on Battleships and higher level Transports or Miners.

Every Red Star can award or take away Influence points. To gain Influence, destroy enough Cerberus ships and take Artifacts to meet the score Threshold displayed under the star icon.
You are earning Influence at a reduced rate. Upgrade your Red Star Scanner to progress faster.
Bring a Battleship to this station to enable scanning for a Blue Star.
Bring a Battleship to this station, or rebuild one of the previously used ones:
Rebuild a new Battleship with a previously used design?
Your ship will jump automatically when the Blue Star is discovered.

Your Battleship is not eligible for Credit rewards because it has SANCTUARY installed.\n\nReplace SANCTUARY with another Module to increase your chances of winning the Blue Star, and to receive credit rewards in any outcome.

The Credit reward is calculated as {0}% of the rebuild cost for the Battleship sent to the Blue Star.\n\nYou will always receive the reward if you lose your ship in the Blue Star. You will also receive it for the first Blue Star win every {1}.
You will receive the full Credit reward regardless of outcome in the next Blue Star mission.
You will not receive any Credit reward if you win the next Blue Star mission. You will still get the reward if you lose your ship. The next win Credit reward will be available in {0}
Cannot start a new Blue Star search this close to planned maintenance.
The Hydrogen awarded depends on your final standing in the Blue Star, and your Empire's maximum storage capacity. There is also a maximum amount of Hydrogen that can be earned per day.
You have earned {0}/{1} Hydrogen for the day.
You will start earning Hydrogen rewards in Blue Stars again in {0}.

Every Blue Star mission will award Blue Star Fragments according to your final standing. Collect these Fragments to power the Shipment Relay station, climb the Blue Star leaderboards, and to receive guaranteed Crystal rewards at the end of every season.\n\nFor more information, see the Blue Star Leaderboards.
A Blue Star Event season is over! You have exceeded {0} Blue Star Fragments and awarded <quad class=''pc''> <c3>{1}</color>
A White Star Event season is over! Your score exceeds {0}, and you are awarded <quad class=''pc''> <c3>{1}</color>

A White Star Event season is over! You are at position {0} of the leaderboards and have received <quad class=''pc''> <c3>{1}</color>
Some rewards may be lost because of capacity issues. Ensure you have enough Credits and Hydrogen capacity before starting the search.
Blue Stars are constantly collapsing. Stay within the safe area towards the center of the star. Ships caught in the collapsing red area will be instantly destroyed.
Do not enter the central sector that contains the Blue Star, unless absolutely necessary. The Blue Star will apply constant damage to all ships inside its sector.
The Battleship that survives the longest is the winner of the Blue Star mission. If the last remaining Battleships are destroyed simultaneously, the match ends in a draw and there is no winner.
Equipping your Battleship with the right modules can be key to winning Blue Stars. View past replays to analyze other players' strategy, and don't be afraid to experiment with new modules.
The goal of the Blue Star is to survive longer than the other Battleships. Avoid engaging in combat with Cerberus ships, or use them against other players.

The current and maximum hull strength for this ship. When hull strength points become 0, the ship is destroyed.

The amount of Hull points repaired per second, when the ship is docked on a planet or station in the Home Star.

Welcome back!

As a returning Alpha participant, you have unlocked the Pioneer distinction.

We have also added an extra 500 Crystals to your account, as special thanks for helping us fine tune the game very early on.

We hope you will enjoy your journey in the Hades Galaxy. Thank you for being an early supporter!

- Hades' Star Team
We have reviewed your support ticket and added {0} Crystals to your account. We apologize for any inconvenience.\n\n- Hades' Star Support Team

Work with your Corporation members to retrieve Relics from this dying White Star.

All planets generate Relics over time. Relics are claimed after the Transport ship carrying them jumps out of the system.

Relic generation can be sped up by Miners depositing Hydrogen on the planets.

Another Corporation may be operating in this area. Battleships will open fire on ships from different Corporations.

Coordinate with your Corporation and decide what ships to send to this White Star to help retrieve Relics.\n\nShips move very slowly in White Stars. Any ships you send through may not be back for days.
As a spectator, you cannot send ships to this White Star.\n\nTo actively participate on a White Star, you must be included in the participants list at the time of the search.
White Stars work best when all participants send in two ships.
Some eligible participants at the bottom of the list may be left out to match the detected Star size.
Increase the number of eligible participants to {0} to claim more rewards from a successful White Star.
The search can take many hours. The mission will begin {0} hours after the Star is found.
Before you can use the White Star Scanner, you must join a Corporation.
Are you sure you want to cancel the search for a White Star?
You need at least {0} eligible participants before you can start a White Star.
When ready, ask an Officer of your Corporation to start the White Star scan.
Transports and Miners will lose all cargo when jumping to a White Star. Proceed?
The amount of Relics this planet generates on its own, adjusted per day.
The amount of Hydrogen that needs to be deposited on this planet, for it to create a new Relic. Smaller deposited quantities will still speed up Relic generation.
This planet generates a constant amount of Relics every day. Relics can be loaded on Transport ships. Depositing Hydrogen with Miners on this planet will speed up Relic generation.
Transports must have cargo capacity of at least {0} before they can jump to a White Star
Time passes by very slowly in White Stars. Use the extra time to coordinate your strategy with your fellow Corporation members.
Miner ships will speed up Relic creation when depositing Hydrogen on White Star planets. Make sure your mining operations are adequately protected against enemy fire.
You can only send a small number of ships to White Stars. Your Corporation may want to discuss in advance who jumps what ship, and when.
Ships docked on the Corporation's return Stargate will automatically jump back to safety when the White Star goes Supernova.
Use the Time Machine to preview combat results and see what state the system will be in once your ships arrive to their destination.
The Delta shield can allow your Battleship to arrive at strategic positions faster than ships with heavier shields.

Players that can participate in a new White Star search will show a faded White Star icon around their player number in the Corporation members list. Players who are participating in an active White Star will show a solid icon.
The more participating members you have in your Corporation, the more likely it will be to detect richer White Stars.
Your transport ships are vulnerable while they are loading Relics. Have a plan to protect them during the entire load operation.
Use the STAR SYSTEM chat tab while in the White Star to privately communicate with your Corporation members. Players from the competing Corporation cannot see your messages.
You cannot upgrade your ships and their modules while they are on the White Star. Pending upgrades will apply when the ships return home.
Cannot teleport inside an enemy Barrier area
Are you sure you want to opt out from White Star searches? You will not be included in your Corporation's future searches.

During the Preparation period, you can jump ships in and give them an initial move order. Ships start moving once Preparation is over.\n\nUse this time to discuss tactics with your Corporation members. You can also schedule Future Orders for your ships, using the Time Machine.

Private Red Star Artifacts Research Bonus
Your White Star search has been cancelled as the {0}vs{0} bracket is no longer supported. For more information, see the release notes on blog.hadesstar.com

Increase the activity bar by dealing <color=''red''>Damage</color> to enemy Battleships, depositing <color=''#8C65FEFF''>Hydrogen</color> or transferring <color=''#FFB800FF''>Relics</color> out of the system.\n\nFill the activity bar and win this White Star to maximize rewards.
If enabled by both participating Corporations, this star will show on the ACTIVE WHITE STARS dialog and can be viewed by anyone.
Any Officer can summon the Flagship to an active White Star, via the Corporation's incoming Jump Gate.

Retrieve your first Relic from a White Star for the opportunity to unlock your Corporation's own Flagship!\n\nThe Flagship is a combat ship that can be sent to help in a single White Star mission at a time. Any Corporation Officer can control the Flagship.

All Corporation members can contribute Credits towards upgrading the Flagship. The upgrade will be applied after the required Credit amount is reached, on the next Flagship deployment. Excess contributions will be saved towards the next upgrade.

All Corporation members can contribute Credits towards unlocking the Flagship. The Flagship will unlock automatically once the required amount is reached. Excess contributions will be saved towards the next upgrade.
Are you sure you want to contribute to the Flagship? This amount will not be refunded if you leave the Corporation.
Show the contribution on the Corporation chat.
Collect more Relics for the opportunity to unlock a new Flagship level.
The Flagship will enter a small cooldown period after it jumps out of a White Star, and a larger cooldown period if it gets destroyed. The Flagship will be fully repaired during the cooldown period.

The Time Machine will show you one out of many potential futures in this White Star. It does not take into account Cerberus tactics, other players' actions, or unpredictable modules like Destiny.\n\nYou can also use this screen to schedule future orders for your ships. The Time Machine takes into account all scheduled orders from members of your Corporation.

Join an existing Corporation, or create a new one.
Open the Chat window by clicking on the blue arrow at the edge of the screen, then select the CORPORATION tab.
Deposit a total of {0} Hydrogen on your planets.
Collect a total of {0} Hydrogen from asteroid fields in Red Stars. The total is updated when the Miner ship returns from the Red Star via the jumpgate.
Send any Miner ship to an asteroid field. The Miner will work automatically, even when you are offline.
Use SHIPMENT COMPUTER to automatically pick up {0} shipments.
Use SHIPMENT DRONE to gain {0} Credits in delivery bonuses.
Collect {0} Credits from TRADE BOOST or TRADE BURST bonuses.
Use EMP to disable {0} enemy ships.
Use REMOTE REPAIR to restore {0} HP to other player's ships.
Use HYDROGEN UPLOAD to transfer a total of {0} Hydrogen from Red Stars.
Collect a total of {0} Hydrogen using CRUNCH.

Expanding to new sectors in your Star System is important for maintaining a healthy economy. All new sectors will contain more asteroid fields to mine Hydrogen from, and some will contain planets you can colonize.

You can use Transport ships to deliver shipments between planets, moons and space stations.\n\nDelivering shipments earns you crucial resources to increase infrastructure and travel further into the star system.
Use a Battleship and Transport ship to retrieve an Artifact from a Red Star, before the star goes Supernova.
Doing regular Red Star missions is crucial for advancing your economy and Technology. The Artifacts retrieved in these missions can be researched to unlock new modules you can equip your ships with.
Build a Research Station to deliver and research the Artifact you retrieved in the Red Star.
A Research Station can be used to deposit Artifacts retrieved in Red Stars. Once deposited, Artifacts will start researching automatically.
Install the recently discovered CARGO BAY EXTENTION module on 2 Transport ships.
Modules that have been researched still have to be individually installed on ships.
Use Transport ships to deliver {0} planet shipments.
Select your planet, then click the Upgrade button at the bottom of the screen.
Select your Shipyard, then click the Upgrade button at the bottom of the screen.
Upgrade your Red Star scanner to level {0}.
Select your Red Star scanner, then click the Upgrade button at the bottom of the screen.
Gain a total of {0} influence by doing Red Star missions.

Start a new Red Star search from your Red Star scanner. Once the star is detected, send in Battleships and Transports to defeat Cerberus forces and retrieve Artifacts. Influence will be awarded when the red star has gone Supernova.
Upgrade the design of your Mining ships to level {0}.
Select your Shipyard, then click the BUILD button at the bottom of the screen. At the bottom of the Miner button select Upgrade Design.

Use Transport ships to go to your planets and moons and pick up shipments. The filled bar over the planet shows how many shipments it holds.\n\nOnce shipments are picked up, select the Transport ship and move it to the glowing shipment destination.
Use your Short Range scanner to uncover a new sector in your Star System.
Select your Short Range Scanner, then press the REVEAL button at the bottom of the screen.
Destroy all Cerberus ships in your star system.

Send your Battleships near the red Cerberus ships to destroy them. Battleships that stick together have a better chance of success.\n\nIf you do not have fleet capacity to build more Battleships, try upgrading your Shipyard.

Start a Red Star search from your Red Star scanner. Send in your Battleships and Transports to receive the required Artifacts from the planets. The Artifacts can then be brought back to your Research station where they will be researched automatically.

Start a Red Star search from your Red Star scanner. Send in your Battleships and Transports to receive the required Artifacts from the planets. The Artifacts can then be brought back to your Research station where they can be salvaged.
Use DESTINY {0} times on a Red Star level {1} or higher. The ship must not be equipped with SANCTUARY.
Load a Transport with at least {0} shipments that go to the same destination, then deliver the shipments. Repeat {1} times.
Apply a total of {0} damage to enemy ships using ALPHA ROCKET.
Use the ENTRUST module to transfer a total of {0} level {1} Artifacts to other player's ships in Red Stars level {2}.
Upgrade all your planets to level 5.
Select each planet, then click the Upgrade button at the bottom of the screen. If you need more Credits to perform the Upgrade, you can deliver more shipments using your Transport ships.
Fill your Research Station with Artifacts retrieved in Red Stars.

To retrieve Artifacts, select your Red Star scanner and press the Scanner Status at the bottom. On the new window, start a new Red Star search.

Move your Battleships and Transports to the Scanner, then jump them to the Red Star using the JUMP button.

In the Red Star, use your Transports to retrieve Artifacts from the planets, and bring them back to your Research station.
Build a second Short Range Scanner.
Select a planet level 3 or higher. Press the BUILD button at the bottom of the screen. Scroll down the construction list and select SHORT RANGE SCANNER.
Select a planet level 6 or higher. Press the BUILD button at the bottom of the screen. Scroll down the construction list and select TIME MODULATOR.
Earn a total of {0} Credits by delivering planet or moon shipments.
Research the BATTERY weapon and install it on a Battleship.

Open the TECHNOLOGY window by clicking on the button at the bottom left of the screen. Scroll down and under WEAPONS, select the BATTERY module. Select UNLOCK.\n\nOnce the module is done researching, select a Battleship and press MODULES. Select the Weapon slot, then REPLACE. Select the newly researched BATTERY module from the install list.
Use SALVAGE to restore {0} hull strength on your ships.
Use SHIPMENT BEAM to pick up {0} shipments remotely.
Absorb {0} area damage using BLAST SHIELD.
Use GENESIS to create {0} new Asteroid fields.
Win a Blue Star using a Battleship equipped with {0}.
